metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31084 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: LDAP Account Manager (LAM) is a webfrontend for managing entries (e.g.users, groups, DHCP settings) stored in an LDAP directory. In versionsprior to 8.0 There are cases where LAM instantiates objects from arbitraryclasses. An attacker can inject the first constructor argument. This canlead to code execution if non-LAM classes are instantiated that executecode during object creation. This issue has been fixed in version 8.0.

criterions.comment: ldap-account-manager: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
